A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Visually stunning\, but insipidly plotted\, with the story line falling into potholes on a regular basis.The First Order can follow the Rebellion through light speed now\, but no one -- including the screenwriters -- figure out that is essentially the end of the rebellion. Pointless trips to a gambling planet and Rey's journey through a mirrored ;pit add absolutely  . . .nothing to the story. And Luke dies because   . . . why? He runs out of energy???? This movie demonstrates how brilliant George Lucas' vision was in its simplicity.
